title: Adding a `resources:ram:1234` tag to a test doesn't work and causes a crash

labels.name: P2
labels.description: We'll consider working on this in future. (Assignee optional)

labels.description: Issues and PRs for the Execution (Local) team

labels.name: help wanted

body:
### Description of the bug:


I'm in a situation where I need to tag some tests as requiring lots of memory so that Bazel doesn't schedule more than one at once. Using `size=enormous` isn't sufficient because the built-in 800MB setting is too low and cannot be changed. Using `exclusive` is too heavy handed because it prevents all parallelism.

Skimming through the code in `TestTargetProperties.java`, I found support for a promising `resources:<resourcename>:<amount>` tag so I tried to tag the tests with `resources:ram:1234`. Unfortunately, doing so made Bazel crash immediately with:


Looking further at the code, it seems that this tag only works to specify the CPU needs of a test (and `resources:cpu:X` is equivalent to `cpu:X`). I also found the `--local_extra_resources` flag, but I have no idea how this plays into the game as it doesn't seem to impact the default resource sets and the flag is not well-documented.

I would like `resources:ram:X` to override the RAM requirements of a test, ignoring whatever the `size` property decides. I do not want to create a new dimension of resources, as `--local_extra_resources` seems to do per https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/18153. And Bazel should not crash.

### Which category does this issue belong to?


Local Execution

### What's the simplest, easiest way to reproduce this bug? Please provide a minimal example if possible.


Add a `resources:ram:1` tag to a test, try to run the test, and see Bazel crash.

### Which operating system are you running Bazel on?


Linux

### What is the output of `bazel info release`?


release 6.3.2
